analyzed: dīgha nikāya
translated: The Long Discourses of the Buddha 3🔽

original: Ambaṭṭhasutta
analyzed: ambaṭṭhasutta
translated: Long Discourses with Ambattha

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi yena icchānaṅgalaṁ nāma kosalānaṁ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā kosalesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi yena icchānaṅgalam nāma kosalānam brāhmaṇagāmaḥ tat avasari
translated: Once the Buddha was wandering in the Kosalan country with a large community of monks, with about five hundred monks. He arrived at a Kosalan village named Icchānaṅgala.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā icchānaṅgale viharati icchānaṅgalavanasaṇḍe.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavān icchānaṅgale viharati icchānaṅgala vana saṇḍe
translated: There he stayed in a forest grove near Icchānaṅgala.

original: 1. Pokkharasātivatthu
analyzed: pokkhara sāti vatthu
translated: The Story of Pokkharasādi

original: Tena kho pana samayena brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti ukkaṭṭhaṁ ajjhāvasati sattussadaṁ satiṇakaṭṭhodakaṁ sadhaññaṁ rājabhoggaṁ raññā pasenadinā kosalena dinnaṁ rājadāyaṁ brahmadeyyaṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti ukkaṭṭham ajjhāvasati sattussadam sa tiṇa kaṭṭhodakam sa dhaññam rāja bhoggam raññā pasenadinā kosalena dinnam rāja dāyam brahmadeyya
translated: At that time the brahmin Pokkharasādi was living in a town called Ukkaṭṭhā, 1 which was rich, prosperous, populous, and full of people. It was a large town with many inhabitants, and it was his ancestral capital.

original: Assosi kho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti:
analyzed: assosi kho brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti
translated: The brahmin Pokkharasādi heard this:

original: “samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ kosalesu cārikam caramānaḥ
translated: “The ascetic Gotama—a son of the Sakyans, gone forth from the Sakyan clan—is wandering in the Kosalan country

original: mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi icchānaṅgalaṁ anuppatto
analyzed: mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi icchā anaṅgalam an uppattaḥ
translated: with a large community of monks, with about five hundred monks.

original: icchānaṅgale viharati icchānaṅgalavanasaṇḍe.
analyzed: icchānaṅgale viharati icchānaṅgala vana saṇḍe
translated: and stayed in the Icchānaṅgala woodland thicket.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato—
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: And this good report about Master Gotama has spread:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā.’🔽So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā  saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti
translated: ‘Such is he, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, perfected in knowledge and conduct, a Well-Farer, knower of the cosmos, incomparable trainer of those who can be trained, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, a Buddha.🔽He makes known—having realized it through direct knowledge—this world with its devas, Māras, and Brahmās, this generation with its contemplatives and brahmans, its royalty and common people.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ, sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇa sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma admirable in its beginning, admirable in its middle, and admirable in its end, with the right meaning and phrasing, and he reveals a holy life that is utterly perfect and pure.’

original: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: It’s good to see such arahants.”

original: 2. Ambaṭṭhamāṇava
analyzed: ambaṭṭha māṇava
translated: The Discussion with Ambattha

original: Tena kho pana samayena brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa ambaṭṭho nāma māṇavo antevāsī
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa ambaṭṭhaḥ nāma māṇavaḥ antevāsī
translated: At that time Ambattha, the brahmin student of Pokkharasati, was staying at Icchānangala, a town of the Kālāmas, with a large company of brahmin students.

original: hoti ajjhāyako mantadharo tiṇṇaṁ vedānaṁ pāragū sanighaṇḍukeṭubhānaṁ sākkharappabhedānaṁ
analyzed: hoti ajjhāyakaḥ manta dharaḥ tiṇṇam vedānam pāragū sa nighaṇḍu keṭubhānam sa akkhara ppabhedānam
translated: He is a master of the Three Vedas with their vocabularies, liturgy, phonology, and etymology,

original: itihāsapañcamānaṁ padako veyyākaraṇo lokāyatamahāpurisalakkhaṇesu anavayo anuññātapaṭiññāto🔽sake ācariyake tevijjake pāvacane:
analyzed: itihāsa pañcamānam padakaḥ veyyākaraṇaḥ lokāyata mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu anavayaḥ anuññāta paṭiññāto  sake ācariyake tevijjake pā vacane
translated: and the histories as a fifth; skilled in philology and grammar, he is fully versed in natural philosophy and in the marks of a Great Man.

original: “yamahaṁ jānāmi taṁ tvaṁ jānāsi;
analyzed: yam aham jānāmi tam tvam jānāsi
translated: He is a teacher of teachers and has a retinue of students.

original: yaṁ tvaṁ jānāsi tamahaṁ jānāmī”ti.
analyzed: yam tvam jānāsi tam aham jānāmi iti
translated: He is well known and famous, and is recognized as an accomplished brahmin.🔽He is a brahmin who has been approved by his brahmin colleagues as qualified to teach the duties of a brahmin.🔽He is a brahmin who has been approved by his brahmin colleagues as qualified to receive a gift of almsfood.

original: Atha kho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti ambaṭṭhaṁ māṇavaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti ambaṭṭham māṇavam āmantesi
translated: Then Pokkharasāti addressed Ambattha,

original: “ayaṁ, tāta ambaṭṭha, samaṇo gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito kosalesu cārikaṁ🔽caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi icchānaṅgalaṁ
analyzed: tāta ambaṭṭha samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ kosalesu cārika  caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi iccha anaṅgala
translated: “Ambattha, the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—

original: anuppatto icchānaṅgale viharati icchānaṅgalavanasaṇḍe.
analyzed: icchānaṅgale viharati icchānaṅgala vana saṇḍe
translated: has arrived at Icchānaṅgala and is staying in a forest grove near Icchānaṅgala.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: He is famous throughout the country,

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā, arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā
translated: ‘This Blessed Lord is an Arahant, a fully-enlightened Buddha, endowed with wisdom and con­duct, the Well-Farer, Knower of the worlds, incomparable Trainer of men to be tamed, Teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed Lord.

original: So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
analyzed: saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti
translated: He, having realised it by his own super-know­ledge, proclaims this world with its devas, maras and Brahmas, its princes and people.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ, sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇa sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He preaches the Dhamma which is lovely in its beginning, lovely in its middle, lovely in its ending, in the spirit and in the letter, and displays the fully- perfected and purified holy life.

original: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī’ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: It is good to see such Arahants.’

original: Ehi tvaṁ, tāta ambaṭṭha, yena samaṇo gotamo tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ jānāhi, yadi vā taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ tathāsantaṁyeva saddo abbhuggato, yadi vā no tathā.
analyzed: ehi tva tāta ambaṭṭha yena samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā samaṇam gotamam jānāhi yadi vā tam bhavantam gotamam tathā asantayā iva saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ yadi vā no tathā
translated: ‘So, dear Ambattha, go to the ascetic Gotama and find out if he is as we have heard, or whether he is different.

original: Yadi vā so bhavaṁ gotamo tādiso, yadi vā na tādiso, tathā mayaṁ taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ vedissāmā”ti.
analyzed: yadi vā saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ tādisaḥ yadi vā na tādisaḥ tathā mayam tam bhavantam gotamam vedissāma ati
translated: Whether he is like that or not, we will know when we see him.”

original: “Yathā kathaṁ panāhaṁ, bho, taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ jānissāmi: ‘yadi vā taṁ bhavantaṁ🔽gotamaṁ tathāsantaṁyeva saddo abbhuggato, yadi vā no tathā. Yadi vā so bhavaṁ gotamo
analyzed: yathā katham pana āha bho tam bhavantam gotamam jānissāmi yadi vā tam bhavanta  gotamam tathā asantayā iva saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ yadi vā no tathā yadi vā saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ
translated: “But how will I know, sir, whether the Lord Buddha is as people say or not?

original: tādiso, yadi vā na tādiso’”ti?
analyzed: tādisaḥ yadi vā na tādisaḥ iti
translated: Whether he is like that or not?”

original: “Āgatāni kho, tāta ambaṭṭha, amhākaṁ mantesu dvattiṁsa mahāpurisalakkhaṇāni, yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dveyeva gatiyo bhavanti anaññā.
analyzed: āgatāni kho tāta ambaṭṭha amhākam mantesu dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇāni yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dveyā iva gatiyaḥ bhavanti anaññā
translated: “My dear Ambattha, in our scriptures there are thirty-two marks of a Great Man. If a Great Man has them, only two courses are open to him.

original: Sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
analyzed: sace agāram ajjhāvasati rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammikaḥ dhamma rājā cāturantaḥ vijitāvī janapadatthāvariya ppatto satta ratana samannāgato
translated: If he lives the home life, he becomes a Wheel-turning Monarch, a righteous king who rules by the Dhamma, master of the four quarters, all-victorious, who has stabilised his country and possesses the seven treasures.

original: Tassimāni satta ratanāni bhavanti.
analyzed: tassa imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti
translated: These are the seven treasures.

original: Seyyathidaṁ—cakkaratanaṁ, hatthiratanaṁ, assaratanaṁ, maṇiratanaṁ, itthiratanaṁ, gahapatiratanaṁ, pariṇāyakaratanameva sattamaṁ.
analyzed: hatthi ratana assa ratana maṇi ratana itthi ratana gahapati ratana pariṇāyaka ratanam eva sattama
translated: namely, the elephant treasure, the horse treasure, the jewel treasure, the woman treasure, the steward treasure, and the counselor treasure.

original: Parosahassaṁ kho panassa puttā bhavanti sūrā vīraṅgarūpā parasenappamaddanā.🔽So imaṁ pathaviṁ sāgarapariyantaṁ adaṇḍena asatthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.
analyzed: parosahassam kho panassa puttāḥ bhavanti sūrāḥ vīraṅga rūpāḥ para sena ppamaddanāḥ  saḥ imam pathavim sāgara pariyantam a daṇḍena a satthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati
translated: He has more than a thousand sons who are heroes, of heroic stature, conquerors of the hostile army.🔽He reigns over the land from sea to sea, a country that is rich and prosperous, with plenty of food and well populated.🔽He does not rule by way of the rod and the sword, but by the Dhamma.

original: Sace kho pana agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati, arahaṁ hoti sammāsambuddho loke vivaṭṭacchado.
analyzed: sace kho pana agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajati araham hoti sammāsambuddhaḥ loke vivaṭṭa chadaḥ
translated: But if he goes forth from the home life into homelessness, he becomes an Accomplished One, a Fully Enlightened One, who draws aside the veil in the world.

original: Ahaṁ kho pana, tāta ambaṭṭha, mantānaṁ dātā;
analyzed: aham khalu pana tāta ambaṭṭha mantānam dātā
translated: I, Ambattha, am the giver of the mantras,

original: tvaṁ mantānaṁ paṭiggahetā”ti.
analyzed: tvam mantānam paṭiggaheta ati
translated: while you are the receiver of the mantras.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa paṭissutvā uṭṭhāyāsanā🔽brāhmaṇaṁ pokkharasātiṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā vaḷavārathamāruyha sambahulehi
analyzed: eva bhoti kho ambaṭṭhaḥ māṇavaḥ brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa paṭissutvā uṭṭhāya āsanā  brāhmaṇam pokkharasātim abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā vaḷavā ratham āruyha sambahulehi
translated: “Yes, sir,” Ambattha replied, and he rose from his seat, paid homage to Pokkharasati, and departed keeping him on his right.🔽Then he mounted a fine carriage,

original: māṇavakehi saddhiṁ yena icchānaṅgalavanasaṇḍo tena pāyāsi.
analyzed: māṇavakehi saddhim yena tena tena
translated: and accompanied by some young men, he drove to the Icchānangala woods.

original: Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikova ārāmaṁ pāvisi.
analyzed: yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikā uva ārāmam pāvisi
translated: He went by vehicle as far as the ground was for vehicles, and then he dismounted from his vehicle and entered the park on foot.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū abbhokāse caṅkamanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sambahulāḥ bhikkhū abbhokāse caṅkamanti
translated: Just then a number of monks were walking up and down in the open air.

original: Atha kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho ambaṭṭhaḥ māṇavaḥ yena te bhikkhū tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etat avoca
translated: Ambattha went up to them and said,

original: “kahaṁ nu kho, bho, etarahi so bhavaṁ gotamo viharati?
analyzed: kaham nu khalu bho etarahi saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ viharati
translated: “Where is Master Gotama staying, the son of the Sakyans, who has gone forth from the Sakyan clan?

original: Tañhi mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāya idhūpasaṅkantā”ti.
analyzed: tat hi mayam bhavantam gotamam dassanāya idhu upasaṅkantā ati
translated: We have come to see him.”

original: Atha kho tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho tesam bhikkhūnam etat ahosi
translated: The monks thought,

original: “ayaṁ kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo abhiññātakolañño ceva abhiññātassa ca brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa antevāsī.
analyzed: ayam kho ambaṭṭhaḥ māṇavaḥ abhiññāta kolaññaḥ ca iva abhiññātassa ca brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa antevāsī
translated: “This Ambattha is a well-known young man, a pupil of the well-known brahmin Pokkharasāti.

original: Agaru kho pana bhagavato evarūpehi kulaputtehi saddhiṁ kathāsallāpo hotī”ti.
analyzed: agaru kho pana bhagavataḥ evarūpehi kula puttehi saddhim kathā sallāpaḥ hoti iti
translated: It would be good if the Buddha were to have a conversation with him.”

original: Te ambaṭṭhaṁ māṇavaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: te ambaṭṭham māṇavam etat avocuḥ
translated: So they said to Ambattha,

original: “eso, ambaṭṭha, vihāro saṁvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṁ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṁ ākoṭehi, vivarissati te bhagavā dvāran”ti.
analyzed: esaḥ ambaṭṭha vihāro savuta dvāro tena appasaddaḥ upasaṅkamitvā a taramānaḥ āḷindam pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷam ākoṭehi vivarissati te bhagavā dvāranti
translated: “Ambattha, that is the closed dwelling. Approach it quietly, without hurrying, enter the porch, clear your throat, and knock on the bolt. The Blessed Lord will open the door for you.”

original: Atha kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo yena so vihāro saṁvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno āḷindaṁ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṁ ākoṭesi. Vivari bhagavā dvāraṁ.🔽Pāvisi ambaṭṭho māṇavo. Māṇavakāpi pavisitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho ambaṭṭhaḥ māṇavaḥ yena saḥ vihāraḥ savuta dvāro tena appasaddaḥ upasaṅkamitvā a taramānaḥ āḷindam pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷam ākoṭesi bhagavā dvāra  pāvisi ambaṭṭhaḥ māṇavaḥ māṇavakāḥ api pavisitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodisu sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: So Ambattha went to the closed dwelling, approached it quietly, without hurrying, entered the porch, cleared his throat, and knocked on the bolt. The Lord opened the door,🔽and Ambattha went in. The other students also went in, and they exchanged courtesies with the Lord, before sitting down to one side.

original: Ambaṭṭho pana māṇavo caṅkamantopi nisinnena bhagavatā kañci kañci kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāreti, ṭhitopi nisinnena bhagavatā kañci kañci kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāreti.
analyzed: ambaṭṭhaḥ pana māṇavaḥ caṅkamantaḥ api nisinnena bhagavatā kañci kañci katham sāraṇīyam vītisāreti ṭhitaḥ upi nisinnena bhagavatā kañci kañci katham sāraṇīyam vītisāreti
translated: But while Ambattha was walking up and down and sitting down, he was unable to find anything to say to the Lord, and so he remained silent.

original: Atha kho bhagavā ambaṭṭhaṁ māṇavaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān ambaṭṭham māṇavam etat avoca
translated: Then the Lord said to him:

original: “evaṁ nu te, ambaṭṭha, brāhmaṇehi vuddhehi mahallakehi ācariyapācariyehi saddhiṁ
analyzed: evam nu te ambaṭṭha brāhmaṇehi vuddhehi mahallakehi ācariya pācariyehi saddhi
translated: “Ambattha, is this how you have discussions with the elder brahmins, the teachers of teachers,

original: kathāsallāpo hoti, yathayidaṁ caraṁ tiṭṭhaṁ nisinnena mayā kiñci kiñci kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretī”ti?
analyzed: kathā sallāpaḥ hoti yathayidam caram tiṭṭham nisinnena mayā kiñci kiñci katham sāraṇīyam vītisāreti iti
translated: that you should be standing while I sit?”

original: 2.1. Paṭhamaibbhavāda
analyzed: paṭhama ep bhavāda
translated: .. The first debate

original: “No hidaṁ, bho gotama.

translated: The two marks

translated: Ambattha also came out of his dwelling and walked up and down.🔽As he was walking up and down with the Blessed One, he examined the Blessed One’s body for the thirty-two marks of a Great Man.

original: Addasā kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo bhagavato kāye dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni yebhuyyena ṭhapetvā dve.

translated: “This Ambattha sees almost all of the thirty-two marks of a great man on me,

original: Dvīsu mahāpurisalakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati nādhimuccati na sampasīdati—
analyzed: dvīsu mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati na adhimuccati na sampasīdati
translated: but he is doubtful, uncertain, undecided, and unconfident about two of the marks of a great man.

original: kosohite ca vatthaguyhe pahūtajivhatāya cā”ti.

translated: The private parts being concealed and the long tongue.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā tathārūpaṁ iddhābhisaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkhāsi. Yathā addasa ambaṭṭho māṇavo bhagavato kosohitaṁ vatthaguyhaṁ.

translated: Then the Blessed One worked such a feat of supernormal power that Ambattha saw the Blessed One’s private parts being concealed.

original: Atha kho bhagavā jivhaṁ ninnāmetvā ubhopi kaṇṇasotāni anumasi paṭimasi, ubhopi nāsikasotāni anumasi paṭimasi, kevalampi nalāṭamaṇḍalaṁ jivhāya chādesi.

translated: Then the Blessed One extended his tongue and, licking the corners of his mouth, he licked his entire forehead.

original: Atha kho ambaṭṭhassa māṇavassa etadahosi:

translated: Then the thought occurred to Ambattha the brahmin student:

original: Bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:

translated: “Now is the time, Ambattha, to do as you think fit.”🔽Then the brahmin student Ambattha, having had a vehicle yoked up, mounted the vehicle and left.

analyzed: tena kho pana samayena brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti ukkaṭṭhāya nikkhamitvā mahatā brāhmaṇa gaṇena saddhim sake ārāme nisinnaḥ hoti ambaṭṭhayā iva māṇavam paṭimānento
translated: Now on that occasion the brahmin Pokkharasati had left Ukkaṭṭhā and was sitting in his own park together with a large number of brahmins, waiting for the brahmin student Ambattha.

original: Atha kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo yena sako ārāmo tena pāyāsi.🔽Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikova yena brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti
analyzed: atha kho ambaṭṭhaḥ māṇavaḥ yena sakaḥ ārāmaḥ tena  yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikā uva yena brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: Then the brahmin student Ambattha went to his own park.🔽When he had gone as far as the vehicle could go, he got down from the vehicle and approached the brahmin Pokkharasati on foot.

original: tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā brāhmaṇaṁ pokkharasātiṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.

translated: He exchanged greetings with the brahmin Pokkharasati and sat down to one side.

translated: and asked him:

analyzed: kacci tāta ambaṭṭha addasa tam bhavantam gotamanti
translated: “I hope you saw the Lord Gotama, Ambattha?”

original: “Addasāma kho mayaṁ, bho, taṁ bhavantaṁ gotaman”ti.
analyzed: addasāma khalu bho tam bhavantam gotamanti
translated: “Yes, sir, we saw him.”

analyzed: kacci tāta ambaṭṭha tam bhavantam gotamam tathā santayā iva saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ no aññathā
translated: “I hope the report about the Lord Gotama is true, Ambattha, and not false?

original: kacci pana so bhavaṁ gotamo tādiso no aññādiso”ti?

translated: I hope he is as you have described him, and not otherwise?”

translated: “The report about the Lord Gotama is true, sir, and not false. He is as you have described him, and not otherwise.

original: Samannāgato ca so bhavaṁ gotamo dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇehi paripuṇṇehi no aparipuṇṇehī”ti.🔽“Ahu pana te, tāta ambaṭṭha, samaṇena gotamena saddhiṁ kocideva kathāsallāpo”ti?
analyzed: samannāgataḥ ca saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇehi paripuṇṇehi no a paripuṇṇehi iti  ahu pana te tāta ambaṭṭha samaṇena gotamena saddhim kocid eva kathā sallāpā uti
translated: And the Lord Gotama is endowed with the thirty-two marks of a Great Man, complete in every detail, not deficient in any.”🔽“But, Ambattha, did you have any conversation with the recluse Gotama?”

original: “Ahu kho me, bho, samaṇena gotamena saddhiṁ kocideva kathāsallāpo”ti.
analyzed: ahu khalu me bho samaṇena gotamena saddhim kocid eva kathā sallāpā uti
translated: “Yes, sir, I had some conversation with him.”

original: “Yathā kathaṁ pana te, tāta ambaṭṭha, ahu samaṇena gotamena saddhiṁ kocideva kathāsallāpo”ti?
analyzed: yathā katham pana te tāta ambaṭṭha ahu samaṇena gotamena saddhim kocid eva kathā sallāpā uti
translated: “But, dear Ambattha, what was the conversation that you had with the recluse Gotama?”

original: Atha kho ambaṭṭho māṇavo yāvatako ahosi bhagavatā saddhiṁ kathāsallāpo, taṁ sabbaṁ brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa ārocesi.
analyzed: atha kho ambaṭṭhaḥ māṇavaḥ yāvatakaḥ ahosi bhagavatā saddhim kathā sallāpo tam sabbam brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa ārocesi
translated: And Ambattha told him all that had happened.

original: Evaṁ vutte, brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti ambaṭṭhaṁ māṇavaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti ambaṭṭham māṇavam etat avoca
translated: When he had finished, Pokkharasati said:

original: “aho vata re amhākaṁ, paṇḍitaka, aho vata re amhākaṁ, bahussutaka, aho vata re amhākaṁ,🔽tevijjaka, evarūpena kira, bho, puriso atthacarakena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ🔽duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjeyya.

translated: “So it seems, my dear Ambattha, that you have been defeated by the recluse Gotama in argument, and that you have been made to seem ridiculous.🔽For if a man is to be reborn in hell for speaking thus of the recluse Gotama, then you, my dear Ambattha, are indeed lost!

original: Yadeva kho tvaṁ, ambaṭṭha, taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ āsajja āsajja avacāsi, atha kho so bhavaṁ gotamo amhepi evaṁ upaneyya upaneyya avaca.
analyzed: yat eva khalu tva ambaṭṭha tam bhavantam gotamam evam āsajja āsajja avacāsi atha kho saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ amhe api evam upaneyya upaneyya avaca
translated: But the recluse Gotama has also been made to seem ridiculous by us.

original: Aho vata re amhākaṁ, paṇḍitaka, aho vata re amhākaṁ, bahussutaka, aho vata re amhākaṁ,🔽tevijjaka, evarūpena kira, bho, puriso atthacarakena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ
analyzed: aho vata re amhāka paṇḍitaka aho vata re amhāka bahussutaka aho vata re amhāka  tevijjakaḥ evarūpena kira bho purisaḥ attha carakena kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāya
translated: “Oh no! Our learned one, our well-read one,🔽our expert in the three Vedas, is going to be reborn in hell!”

original: duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjeyyā”ti, kupito anattamano ambaṭṭhaṁ māṇavaṁ padasāyeva pavattesi.
analyzed: duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjeyya iti kupitaḥ anatta manaḥ ambaṭṭham māṇavam padasāya iva pavattesi
translated: and he kicked Ambattha with his foot.

original: Icchati ca tāvadeva bhagavantaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ.
analyzed: icchati ca tāvat eva bhagavantam dassanāya upasaṅkamitu
translated: But he still wanted to go to see the Buddha.

analyzed: pokkhara sātibuddhu upasaṅkamana
translated: Pokkharasati’s visit to the Buddha

translated: “It’s too late to go to see the ascetic Gotama today.

translated: But you can go tomorrow.”

original: Atha kho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti sake nivesane paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā
analyzed: atha kho brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti sake nivesane paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā
translated: Pokkharasati then had various kinds of fine food prepared in his own house

original: yāne āropetvā ukkāsu dhāriyamānāsu ukkaṭṭhāya niyyāsi, yena icchānaṅgalavanasaṇḍo tena pāyāsi.🔽Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi yānena gantvā, yānā paccorohitvā pattikova yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: yāne āropetvā ukkāsu dhāriyamānāsu ukkaṭṭhāya niyyāsi yena tena  yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikā uva yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami
translated: and had him carried out on a litter by the bearers.🔽He went as far as the ground was passable for a vehicle, and then he continued on foot to the Blessed One.

original: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā
translated: He then exchanged greetings with the Blessed One and, when this courteous and amiable talk was finished,

original: ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: he sat down at one side and said to him:

original: “āgamā nu khvidha, bho gotama, amhākaṁ antevāsī ambaṭṭho māṇavo”ti?
analyzed: nu khvidha bho gotama amhākam antevāsī ambaṭṭhaḥ māṇavaḥ iti
translated: “Master Gotama, has our pupil Ambattha come here?”

original: “Āgamā kho te, brāhmaṇa, antevāsī ambaṭṭho māṇavo”ti.
analyzed: āgama kho te brāhmaṇa antevāsī ambaṭṭhaḥ māṇava iti
translated: “Yes, brahmin, your pupil Ambattha has come here.”

original: “Ahu pana te, bho gotama, ambaṭṭhena māṇavena saddhiṁ kocideva kathāsallāpo”ti?
analyzed: ahu pana te bho gotama ambaṭṭhena māṇavena saddhim kocid eva kathā sallāpā uti
translated: “But did you have some conversation with him, Master Gotama?”

original: “Ahu kho me, brāhmaṇa, ambaṭṭhena māṇavena saddhiṁ kocideva kathāsallāpo”ti.
analyzed: ahu kho me brāhmaṇa ambaṭṭhena māṇavena saddhim kocid eva kathā sallāpā uti
translated: “Yes, brahmin, I had some conversation with him.”

original: “Yathākathaṁ pana te, bho gotama, ahu ambaṭṭhena māṇavena saddhiṁ kocideva kathāsallāpo”ti?
analyzed: yathākatham pana te bho gotama ahu ambaṭṭhena māṇavena saddhim kocid eva kathā sallāpā uti
translated: “What was the conversation that you had with Ambattha?”

original: Atha kho bhagavā yāvatako ahosi ambaṭṭhena māṇavena saddhiṁ kathāsallāpo, taṁ sabbaṁ brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa ārocesi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā yāvatakaḥ ahosi ambaṭṭhena māṇavena saddhim kathā sallāpo tam sabbam brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa ārocesi
translated: And the Lord told him all that had happened.

original: Evaṁ vutte, brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When he had finished, Pokkharasati said:

original: “bālo, bho gotama, ambaṭṭho māṇavo, khamatu bhavaṁ gotamo ambaṭṭhassa māṇavassā”ti.
analyzed: bālaḥ bho gotama ambaṭṭhaḥ māṇavaḥ khamatu bhavam gotamaḥ ambaṭṭhassa māṇavassa ati
translated: “Ambattha is a fool, Reverend Gotama. Please forgive him.”

original: “Sukhī hotu, brāhmaṇa, ambaṭṭho māṇavo”ti.🔽Atha kho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti bhagavato kāye dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni samannesi.🔽Addasā kho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti bhagavato kāye dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni yebhuyyena ṭhapetvā dve.
analyzed: sukhī hotu brāhmaṇa ambaṭṭhaḥ māṇava iti  atha kho brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti bhagavato kāye dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇāni samannesi  addasā kho brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti bhagavato kāye dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇāni yebhuyyena ṭhapetvā dve
translated: “May Ambattha prosper, Brahmin.”🔽Then Pokkharasati examined the Lord’s body for the thirty-two marks of a Great Man.🔽He saw all of them except for two.

original: Dvīsu mahāpurisalakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati nādhimuccati na sampasīdati—
analyzed: dvīsu mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati na adhimuccati na sampasīdati
translated: He was in doubt and uncertainty about two of the marks, and he could not make up his mind about them:

original: kosohite ca vatthaguyhe pahūtajivhatāya ca.
analyzed: ca vattha guyhe pahūta jivha tāya ca
translated: his private parts are concealed, and his tongue is large.

original: Atha kho bhagavato etadahosi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavataḥ
translated: Then the thought occurred to the Blessed One,

original: “passati kho me ayaṁ brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni yebhuyyena ṭhapetvā dve.
analyzed: passati kho me ayam brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇāni yebhuyyena ṭhapetvā dve
translated: “This brahmin Pokkharasati sees the thirty-two marks of a Great Man on me, except for two.

original: Dvīsu mahāpurisalakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati nādhimuccati na sampasīdati—
analyzed: dvīsu mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati na adhimuccati na sampasīdati
translated: He is doubtful, uncertain, undecided about two of the marks of a Great Man:

original: kosohite ca vatthaguyhe pahūtajivhatāya cā”ti.
analyzed: kosohite ca vattha guyhe pahūta jivha tāya ca ati
translated: his private parts are concealed, and his tongue is large.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā tathārūpaṁ iddhābhisaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkhāsi yathā addasa brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti bhagavato kosohitaṁ vatthaguyhaṁ.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā tathārūpam iddha abhisaṅkhāram abhisaṅkhāsi yathā addasa brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti bhagavataḥ kosohitam vattha guyha
translated: Then the Blessed One worked such a feat of supernormal power that the brahmin Pokkharasati saw the Blessed One’s private parts concealed.

original: Atha kho bhagavā jivhaṁ ninnāmetvā ubhopi kaṇṇasotāni anumasi paṭimasi, ubhopi nāsikasotāni anumasi paṭimasi, kevalampi nalāṭamaṇḍalaṁ jivhāya chādesi.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā jivham ninnāmetvā ubho api kaṇṇa sotāni anumasi paṭimasi ubho api nāsika sotāni anumasi paṭimasi kevalam pi nalāṭa maṇḍalam jivhāya chādesi
translated: Then the Blessed One, extending his long, slender tongue, licked the corners of his mouth and the apertures of his ears, and he covered his entire forehead with his long, slender tongue.

original: Atha kho brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa etat ahosi
translated: Then the thought occurred to the brahmin Pokkharasati,

original: “samannāgato kho samaṇo gotamo dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇehi paripuṇṇehi no aparipuṇṇehī”ti.
analyzed: samannāgataḥ kho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇehi paripuṇṇehi no a paripuṇṇehi iti
translated: “The ascetic Gotama is endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man, complete, not incomplete.”

original: Bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He said to the Buddha,

original: “adhivāsetu me bhavaṁ gotamo ajjatanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhavam gotamaḥ ajjatanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: “May Master Gotama together with the Sangha of bhikkhus accept tomorrow’s meal from me.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocesi:
analyzed: atha khalu brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā bhagavataḥ kālam ārocesi
translated: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, Pokkharasati announced the time:

original: “kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.🔽Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena yena brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: kālaḥ bho gotama niṭṭhitam bhattanti  atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena yena brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: “It’s time, Master Gotama, the meal is ready.”🔽Then, having had a good meal of fresh food, the Buddha addressed the Venerable Ānanda:🔽“Come, Ānanda, we will go to the royal rest-house in the mango grove.”🔽“Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.🔽Then the Buddha together with a number of monks went to the royal rest-house in the mango grove.

original: Atha kho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti bhagavantaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi, māṇavakāpi bhikkhusaṅghaṁ.
analyzed: atha kho brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti bhagavantam paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi māṇavaka api bhikkhu saṅgha
translated: Pokkharasāti served the Buddha and his Sangha of monks with fresh food of various kinds, and the young brahmins did the same for the Sangha of monks.

original: Atha kho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho brāhmaṇaḥ pokkharasāti bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim aññataram nīcam āsanam gahetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: When the Buddha had finished his meal, Pokkharasati took a low seat and sat to one side to listen to the Dharma.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnassa kho brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa bhagavā anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnassa kho brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa bhagavā anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: The Buddha gave him a graduated talk:

original: dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ; kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ, nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: dāna katham sīla katham sagga katha kāmānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesa nekkhamme ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: talk on generosity, talk on virtue, talk on heaven, and he explained the danger, degradation, and defilement in worldly pleasures, and the benefit of renunciation.

original: Yadā bhagavā aññāsi brāhmaṇaṁ pokkharasātiṁ kallacittaṁ muducittaṁ vinīvaraṇacittaṁ udaggacittaṁ pasannacittaṁ, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi—
analyzed: yadā bhagavā aññāsi brāhmaṇam pokkharasātim kalla cittam mudu cittam vinīvaraṇa cittam udagga cittam pasanna citta atha yā buddhānam sāmukkasikā dhamma desanā tam pakāsesi
translated: When the Buddha knew that Pokkharasati’s mind was ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

original: dukkhaṁ samudayaṁ nirodhaṁ maggaṁ.🔽Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
analyzed: dukkham samudayam nirodham magga  seyyathā api nāma suddham vattham apagata kāḷakam sammat eva rajanam paṭiggaṇheyya
translated: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.🔽Just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

original: evameva brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa tasmiññeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
analyzed: evam eva brāhmaṇassa pokkharasātissa tasmin ñeva āsane virajam vīta malam dhamma cakkhum udapādi
translated: in the same way, while he was sitting right there, Pokkharasati experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

original: “yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman”ti.
analyzed: yam kiñci samudaya dhammam sabbam tat nirodha dhamman ti
translated: “Whatever has the nature to arise, all that has the nature to stop.”

original: 9. Pokkharasātiupāsakattapaṭivedanā
analyzed: pokkhara sāti upāsaka tta paṭivedanā
translated: Pokkharasāti’s declaration of the state of stream-entry

original: Atha kho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo
analyzed: atha kho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti diṭṭha dhammo patta dhammo vidita dhammo pariyogāḷha dhammo
translated: Then Pokkharasāti saw the Dhamma, attained the Dhamma, understood the Dhamma, fathomed the Dhamma,

original: tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṅkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: tiṇṇa vicikicchaḥ vigata kathaṅkathaḥ vesārajja ppatto apara ppaccayaḥ satthu sāsane bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: crossed over doubt, dispelled uncertainty, and became independent of others regarding the Teacher’s teachings. He said to the Buddha,

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.🔽Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama  seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: “Excellent, sir! Excellent!

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Just as, sir, one might set upright what has been overturned, or open up what has been closed, or show a path to one who is lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what’s there—

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: just so has the Buddha made the Teaching clear in many ways.

original: Esāhaṁ, bho gotama, saputto sabhariyo sapariso sāmacco bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aha bho gotama sa puttaḥ sa bhariyaḥ sa parisaḥ sāmaccaḥ bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gataṁ.🔽Yathā ca bhavaṁ gotamo ukkaṭṭhāya aññāni upāsakakulāni upasaṅkamati, evameva bhavaṁ gotamo pokkharasātikulaṁ upasaṅkamatu.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gata  yathā ca bhavam gotamaḥ ukkaṭṭhāya aññāni upāsaka kulāni upasaṅkamati evam eva bhavam gotamaḥ pokkharasāti kulam upasaṅkamatu
translated: Please accept me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.🔽Just as the Lord Gotama visits other leading brahmin families in Ukkaṭṭhā, so he should visit the Pokkharasāti family.

original: Tattha ye te māṇavakā vā māṇavikā vā bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ abhivādessanti vā paccuṭṭhissanti
analyzed: tattha ye te māṇavakāḥ vā māṇavikāḥ vā bhavantam gotamam abhivādessanti vā paccuṭṭhissanti
translated: And those young men and women who pay homage to the Lord Gotama, rise up for him,

original: vā āsanaṁ vā udakaṁ vā dassanti cittaṁ vā pasādessanti, tesaṁ taṁ bhavissati dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
analyzed: vā āsanam vā udakam vā dassanti cittam vā pasādessanti tesam tam bhavissati dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: offer him a seat and water, and become spiritually receptive, will have everlasting benefit and happiness.”

original: “Kalyāṇaṁ vuccati, brāhmaṇā”ti.
analyzed: kalyāṇam vuccati brāhmaṇa ati
translated: “It is said to be good, brahmin.”

original: Ambaṭṭhasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: ambaṭṭha suttam niṭṭhitam tatiya
translated: The third section for recitation on Ambattha is finished.
